sentences.english: "Yes, something did happen, " Taras said, with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “出了一點毛病，”塔拉斯笑眯眯地說。

sentences.english: "Third door on the left." the woman replied with a smile.
sentences.chinese: “左邊第三個門，”女售貨員笑眯眯地回答。

sentences.english: They looked at each other, the old man still beaming.
sentences.chinese: 兩人對視着，老人仍然笑眯眯的。

sentences.english: The domestic big Ye smilingly says.
The maid big Ye smilingly says.
His great walrus mustache curved above his beaming mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他的海象鬍子在笑眯眯的嘴巴上抖動着。

sentences.english: When I was in kindergarten, I was very good-looking, I had beautiful hair and I smiled all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我小時候很帥，頭髮也很漂亮，整天笑眯眯的。

sentences.english: She aided Xu Man Dao cup water, sit just along the avenue smilingly seeing at her to eat.
sentences.chinese: 她幫徐曼到了杯水，坐在對面笑眯眯的看着她喫。

sentences.english: Tom sat there smiling, as happy as a clam.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆笑眯眯坐在那兒，一副心滿意足的樣子。

definition: like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
smiling wholeheartedly (idiom); beaming from ear to ear
to have a smile on one's face
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
